metadata.title: CVE-2021-32672 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Redis is an open source, in-memory database that persists on disk. Whenusing the Redis Lua Debugger, users can send malformed requests that causethe debuggerâ€™s protocol parser to read data beyond the actual buffer. Thisissue affects all versions of Redis with Lua debugging support (3.2 ornewer). The problem is fixed in versions 6.2.6, 6.0.16 and 5.0.14.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.2+esm3
redis-sentinel - 5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.2+esm3
redis-server - 5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.2+esm3
redis-tools - 5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.2+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: redis package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5:4.0.9-1ubuntu0.2+esm3').
